H0.text: A magnet touching the loop of wire is a set of conditions that will produce an electric current in a closed loop of wire.

H1.text: A magnet at rest inside the loop of wire will produce an electric current in a closed loop of wire.

H2.text: A magnet at rest outside the loop of wire is a set of conditions that will produce an electric current in a closed loop of wire.

H3.text: A magnet passing through the loop of wire will produce an electric current in a closed loop of wire.

A4.text: He observed transient currents when a bar magnet was rapidly moved into or out of a coil of wire.

A5.text: Initial experiments revealed that a static magnetic field had no effect on a nearby circuit: simply placing a magnet near a wire loop produced no current.
